title: International Personal Finance signs former Microsoft exec to board
text:

Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 16:50 BST - UK Markets closed International Personal Finance signs former Microsoft exec to board By Victoria Young | Sharecast – 4 minutes 50 seconds ago 45.73 -1.55 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Home credit business International Personal Finance (LSE: IPF.L - news ) appointed John Mangelaars to its board, effective immediately. Mangelaars was the chief executive of online travel agency Travix International. He had worked for Microsoft (NasdaqGS: MSFT - news ) for over 20 years, specialising in more recent years in the sale and marketing of online products MSN Messenger, Hotmail and Bing. 
International Personal Finance chairman Dan O'Connor said Mangelaars' experience in sales and e-commence would be a valuable addition to the board. 
Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) in the company were up 0.28% to 387.60p at 1530 BST.
